views.markdown:
Supports iOS 10, 11, 12 and 13 "out-of-the-box", can support older versions, read technical information below.



Succession is a tool that allows completely restoring your iOS device back to stock. Succession (unlike iTunes) does this without updating the device, so that after the restore, you are still able to jailbreak your device. In addition, Succession does not require SHSH blobs.

This is useful if you are having problems with your current setup and you'd like to start fresh or if you would like to sell or give away your jailbroken device without updating it.

Succession is very similar to a tool called "Cydia Eraser", however instead of using OTA updates, which makes it much easier to update for newer iOS versions.

**WARNING!** Succession will delete all data on the device, unless you enable "Only restore system data" in settings. **PLEASE BACK UP ANY DATA YOU WANT TO KEEP**.

Technical information, most users probably don't need to read this:

Succession works in two parts: an IPSW downloader/extractor and DMG mount/sync.

The IPSW downloader/extractor supports iOS 10.0+, and will automatically download an IPSW for your device and iOS version from Apple's servers and extract the root filesystem DMG. You can also manually place an IPSW in /var/mobile/Media/Succession/ipsw.ipsw (file path is configurable in Succession's settings) and use Succession to automatically extract the IPSW, or you can manually download the IPSW for your iOS version and manually extract the root filesystem and place it in /var/mobile/Media/Succession/rfs.dmg (if you are on iOS 9.3.5 or older, you will also need to decrypt the IPSW)

The DMG mount/sync supports older iOS versions (even versions that the downloader/extractor doesn't support, however I do not recommend using this on any version older than 7.0 because I haven't tested it there yet), the DMG from your previously downloaded IPSW is mounted on /var/MobileSoftwareUpdate/mnt1/, then rsync is run to replace any changed files on your filesystem with the ones in the DMG. Finally, Succession tells iOS to run "Erase all content and settings" (which is now safe, since the device is now fully unjailbroken)

For developers: Succession is open source and GPL3! Check it out

App is added to home screen. Preferences available on the Settings page of the app.

* Undo committed test code (whoops) * Add posix_spawn as a fallback for NSTask * Fix a few UI bugs * Add handling for Apple pulling IPSWs (if this practice is intentional/permanent, this could be the "omega build"... let's hope not) * Remove "upcoming hacktivation feature" as there were too many challenges. Sorry about that :/ * Fix and re-enable 32-bit support (thanks to @PixelmonGalaxyY for testing on 32-bit!)
* Fixes issue where tapping "Erase iPhone" did nothing


* Completely re-write restore code to fix mounting issues

*This release will not work on 32-bit devices 9.3.6 and older and is therefore disabled. It may have issues on 32-bit 10.0-10.3.4 as well, I'm still working to fix these problems in a future update.*


* Add full iOS 13 support * Adds support for iOS 8.0-9.3.6 (decrypting DMGs) for the following devices:
iPhone 4s: All versions, 8.0-9.3.5 (9.3.6 not supported at this time)
iPhone 5: All versions, 8.0-9.3.5
iPhone 5s: All versions, 8.0-9.3.5
iPhone 6: All versions, 8.0-9.3.5
iPhone 6 Plus: All versions, 8.0-9.3.5
iPhone 6S: All versions, 9.0-9.3.5
iPhone 6S Plus: Not supported.
iPhone SE: Not supported.
All iPad models are supported, 8.0-9.3.5, EXCEPT the iPad Pro 12.9" first gen and the iPad Pro 9.7" first gen
All iPod touch models are supported on all versions, 8.0-9.3.5

* Add coolbooter secondary partition support (restore rootfs mode only)

* Improve download progress responsiveness

* add extract progress when using manually placed ipsws

* workaround for issue with rsync and unc0ver's Substitute (monolithic)
* add arm64e attach
* fix arm64e postinst
* move hdik decision to install instead of first run
* fix logic issue with postinst


* Remove redundant root check because it was misfiring


* Completely remove xerub's attach
* Add exclusions inside /var/ as a safety feature (in case succession crashes during restore, bootlooping is now much less likely)
* Fixes "You don't have permission to save 'mnt1' inside 'MobileSoftwareUpdate' directory" error when creating mountpoint
* Mounting supported on iOS 8.0-9.3.5, but not compiled for those versions as it's not safe to use yet. Support for iOS 8.0-9.3.5 for most 32-bit devices is planned in Succession 1.4.
* Faster zip extraction
* Use hdik for attaching to prepare for iOS 9.X support
* Automatic mounting when Restore view loads
* After this update, downloaded DMGs will not be deleted by future updates, only by (re/un)installs, thanks @OothecaPickle
* Adds more logging to the restore page
* Makes mounting more stable
* Fixes a crash when tapping "Begin restore" on iPads
* Fixes an incompatibility with uikittools
* Fixes an issue with attaching filesystems
* Adds the ability to create a new orig-fs snapshot of the restored filesystem
* Adds the ability to create a "succession-prerestore" snapshot of the filesystem before restoring to allow undoing the restore at a later time
* Adds support for A12 devices
* Fixed a few UI bugs
* better performance when mounting
* Completely re-write mount code to make it work on all devices
* Improves clean up to prevent deleting /tmp
* Adds support for beta firmwares (each version must be manually added)
* Adds support for Sileo/Chimera
* Creates mountpoint if it doesn’t exist


* actually fixes the mount hanging bug by using better HFS/APFS identification
* uicache after restoring system data only to clear uninstalled system apps from the home screen
* improves detection of when the restore is finished
* prevents the “setup loop” bug caused by removing LZMA
* Fixes hanging on mount
* Automatically removes unfinished downloads
* Fixes an issue where using a custom IPSW path while simultaneously placing the IPSW in the correct folder, but with the wrong name would lead to endlessly "extracting"
* Fixes an issue with 32-bit devices on 10.3-10.3.3 not mounting


* Adds custom IPSW path specification in Succession's settings
* Fixes a bug where /var/mobile/Media/Succession/ did not have correct permissions for some users
* If an IPSW is present in /var/mobile/Media/Succession, but it is not named "ipsw.ipsw", an alert will be presented allowing users to automatically rename it.
* Adds profile pictures to credits page
* Adds proactive credit to MidnightChips for upcoming APFS snapshot features
